Voters in Ireland have reelected their president Michel ... with a strong majority as Joe Zephyr and reports from Dublin it appears voters also passed a referendum which removes the word blasphemous from the Irish Constitution
Seventy seven year old Labour party candidate Michael D Higgins will now serve his second seven year term
He received fifty six percent of first preference votes cast on friday and counted on Saturday the role of president in Ireland is largely ceremonial which means the government is still controlled by the right wing party finish whale results are still being tallied for the blasphemy referendum but exit polls reveal more than two thirds of voters approved it
When confirmed that word blasphemous will be removed from article forty of the constitution the dish and and and decency to other acts banned in that article were not up for vote and will remain illegal for now

Police in cities around the U.S are ramping up security up synagogues after at least eleven people were killed by a gunman up the tree of life synagogue in Pittsburgh Saturday morning forty six year old Robert Bowers was taken into custody after a gun battle with police Bob Jones is head of the FBI's Pittsburgh office
This is the most horrific crime scene I've seen in twenty two years the Federal Bureau of investigation members of the tree of life synagogue conducting a peaceful service and their place of worship were brutally murdered by a gunman targeting them simply because of their faith the suspects full motives unknown but we believe he was acting alone
Federal prosecutors charging Bowers with twenty nine count Saturday Night including weapons of fences and hate crimes President Trump condemned the shooting
It doesn't mean that we can fight hard and be strong
And say what's on our mind but we have to always remember those elements we have to remember the elements of love and dignity and respect hundreds
Gathered at a candlelight vigil Saturday evening in Pittsburgh this is NPR News
NASA engineers still haven't heard from the six wheeled Mars rover known as opportunity as NPR's Joe Palca reports the rover went silent last June after an enormous dust storm and Gulf a planet
Opportunity gets its power from solar panels and when the dust storm hit the panels apparently weren't able to recharge the on board battery
Mission manager think the rover essentially put itself to sleep waiting for guys to clear
Now that the guys are clear but there's still no signal from the rover
It may be that there's too much on the panels for them to work properly but engineers are hoping that wind storms on Mars could clean off the panels so they haven't given up hope the rover will wake up and phone home opportunity landed on Mars in two thousand for for what was originally intended to be a Ninety Days mission
No one expected the rover to last for more than fourteen years Joe Palca NPR News Pasadena

The New Hampshire Supreme Court is allowing a new voter registration law to remain in effect in the upcoming elections as New Hampshire Public Radio's Casey McDermott reports the ruling comes just days after a lower court with the law on hold
Hampshire's high court did not take a position on the merits of the twenty Seventeen law
That law requires voters to prove they live where they're trying to vote a legal challenge has been ongoing since last year and on Monday a lower court ruled that it should be put on hold for the IRS mid term because it could cause confusion among voters and poll workers
For the IRS mid term because it could cause confusion among voters and poll workers but state attorneys resisted that order saying a change in plans so close to election day would likely cause even more confusion
The state Supreme Court agreed unanimously saying the new law and new requirements should stay in place for now
For NPR News I'm Casey McDermott in Concord New Hampshire
This is NPR
Human rights activists in Serbia or condemning a government moved to publish the books of war criminals as Joanna Kakissis reports from Athens A un court convicted the two ex generals atrocities committed during the war in Kosovo Twenty years ago
The certain military officers now the ... were jailed for participating in a terror campaign against ethnic Albanians in Kosovo
More than ten thousand people died in nearly a million were displaced during the war positive aging lives out of H wrote testimonies of the Seventy eight day NATO bombing in Nineteen Ninety nine that push Serbian forces out of Kosovo the Serbian defence ministry promoted these testimonies at a book fair the
Balkans based group called the youth initiative for human rights says the shows that the government is trying to rehabilitate war criminals Pasca may just serving a twenty two year prison term ... served fourteen years and was released in twenty Fifteen for NPR News I'm Joanna Kakissis in Athens
